Module com.example.navalbattleminiproject3
Package com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.model.board.Board

Class PlayerBoard

java.lang.Object
com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.model.board.Board.BoardAdapter
com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.model.board.Board.PlayerBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBoard, Serializable
public class PlayerBoard extends BoardAdapter
Represents the player's game board, extending BoardAdapter. Provides methods for boat spawning, shooting at the bot's board, and managing game state.
See Also:

    • PlayerBoard

      public PlayerBoard()
      Default constructor for the PlayerBoard. Initializes the board, boat list, and player data. Sets up the initial board state and available boats.

    • isWinnner

      public boolean isWinnner()
      Checks if the player has won the game by sinking all boats.
      Returns:
      true if the player has won, false otherwise.

    • boatSunk

      public void boatSunk()
      Increments the number of boats sunk by the player in the current game. Also increments the total number of boats sunk by the player.

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Resets the player's game state, clearing all boats and resetting counters.

    • spawnBoat

      public boolean spawnBoat(int row, int column, int direction, int boatType)
      Spawns a boat on the board at the specified location with the given direction.
      Specified by:
      spawnBoat in interface IBoard
      Overrides:
      spawnBoat in class BoardAdapter
      Parameters:
      row - the starting row index for the boat.
      column - the starting column index for the boat.
      direction - the direction of the boat (0 for horizontal, 1 for vertical).
      boatType - the type of the boat (size).
      Returns:
      true if the boat was successfully spawned, false otherwise.

    • shootInOtherBoard

      public boolean shootInOtherBoard(BoardAdapter attackedBoard, int row, int column)
      Shoots at a specified location on another board.
      Specified by:
      shootInOtherBoard in interface IBoard
      Overrides:
      shootInOtherBoard in class BoardAdapter
      Parameters:
      attackedBoard - the BoardAdapter representing the board being attacked.
      row - the row index of the target cell.
      column - the column index of the target cell.
      Returns:
      true if the shot hits and sinks a boat, false otherwise.
